text: Barbie Sparkling Ice Show is a 2002 video game within the Barbie franchise developed by Australian developer Krome Studios and published by Vivendi Universal Games for Windows.https://www.mobygames.com/game/barbie-sparkling- ice-show 38 people who worked on this title would contribute to The Adventures of Jimmy Neutron: Boy Genius - Jet Fusion. Nicole Stark served as a lead animator. ==Reception== 7Wolf wrote that the game was "pleasant - relaxing, and most importantly not annoying". EdutainingKids praised the engaging graphics and ability to be learnt quickly. The Odyssy Online wrote the game was difficult to play for non skaters. Emily Aguilo-Perez of 2015 Strong Research Fellow wrote that the game was an example of how she observed "Barbie permeat[ing] children’s culture through...media". Twiinfinite deemed it a classic of the console generation, alongside Ocarina of Tim and Final Fantasy VII and compared it to Animal Crossing saying "just trust us on this". It received a 'Recommended' from Parent's Choice for Winter 2002 Software. == References == Category:2002 video games Category:Barbie video games Category:Sports video games Category:Video games developed in Australia Category:Windows games Category:Windows-only games
